AnsweredQuestion.Name: Try Area rather than Height
AnsweredQuestion.Description: Height is better than Area in separating the data points.

AnsweredQuestion.Name: Use 2010's call to color data points
AnsweredQuestion.Description: it looks like 2010 has some errors, like snpid=34. the few heterozygous calls in 2010 are undisputably homozygous in cluster plots. also some homozygous calls in 2010 fall into the other allele's cloud in cluster plots.

DEFAULT.Name: Summary
DEFAULT.Description: a difference matrix by all data

AnsweredQuestion.Name: inconsistent results
AnsweredQuestion.Description:
Two programs (CmpAccession2Ecotype.py, Cmp149SNPVs2010.py) doing the same thing as computing the difference matrix give different outcomes.
Cmp149SNPVs2010.py maps a lot more heterozygous calls in sequenom to NA in 2010 than CmpAccession2Ecotype.py. It turned out those NAs are not touched (no fragment sequenced) in 2010. The results are actually same.

DEFAULT.Name: cross match/sample mixup
DEFAULT.Description: for a given strain's 149SNP data, calculate its distance to any strain's 2010 data

DEFAULT.Name: association mapping by haplotype clustering
DEFAULT.Description: write a GUI to pinpoint data

DEFAULT.Name: phenotype data => database
DEFAULT.Description:
1. link at.phenotype and at.experiment 2. put data into db
Kas-2 id replaced with Kas-1 id Van-0's phenotype is 144 hrs. truncate it to 72.

DEFAULT.Name: LD curve fitting to each SNP
DEFAULT.Description: try to find out spots with very low LD decay. not successful, either r^2 = 1/(a+bx) or r^2 = ax^b(slightly better) doesn't give very good fitting results cuz the data is too noisy. maybe only pair two SNPs with similar allele frequency.

DEFAULT.Name: selfing rate
DEFAULT.Description: selfing rates in different regions, north america same as europe?

DEFAULT.Name: QC
DEFAULT.Description: 1st strain selecting, 2nd throw away bad SNP columns, 3rd is merging same strain data

DEFAULT.Name: Generate good 96x250k matrix
DEFAULT.Description:
1. throw out bad strains 2. swap strains 2.5. select strains by lowest mismatch rate 3. throw away bad SNPs 4. Merge Duplicated Calls
* use version=3 2010 data * add perlegen data for SNP screening

DEFAULT.Name: structural variation
DEFAULT.Description:
inversion, deletion, insertion. cause LD/recombination disruption etc
how to detect that in SNP hybridization data
